posts.post_content:
Taking offers. Email me at [url]jl@jeffreylichtman.com[/url]. 

[URL="http://www.flickr.com/photos/calvindog/2909241061/"][IMG]http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3232/2909241061_7a22b05349_o.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

[URL="http://www.flickr.com/photos/calvindog/8788514124/"][IMG]http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7308/8788514124_da18596de7_o.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

Jeff,

That is one nice miscut.  Did you ask SGC for the Authentic or was that their assessment?

Good luck with the sale.

r/
Frank
Any idea of the price range ? Verry cool card
Wish I didn't have a wedding to pay for.

[quote name="Rob D." post=1133249]Wish I didn't have a wedding to pay for.[/QUOTE]

Don't remind me, great card Jeff!

[quote name="g_vezina_c55" post=1133247]Any idea of the price range ? Verry cool card[/QUOTE]

Nelson, I'm pricing the card based on recent sales of miscut T206s such as the Doolin in REA which was creased and, well, is Doolin, and sold for nearly 10K.

[quote name="calvindog" post=1133264]Nelson, I'm pricing the card based on recent sales of miscut T206s such as the Doolin in REA which was creased and, well, is Doolin, and sold for nearly 10K.[/QUOTE]

Thx jeff . Amazing price for the doolin. With all t206 oddities collector here you will find buyer for sure !
I remember when it came into SGC. Very cool item and I too think it is the right time to sell such a truly unique piece.
Same card that sold in the 2007 Legendary Auctions?

[quote name="warrior1978" post=1133297]Same card that sold in the 2007 Legendary Auctions?[/QUOTE]

That might be a different green background, miscut Cobb.
Too funny.

[quote name="rob d." post=1133299]that might be a different green background, miscut cobb.[/quote]

lol

Great card, Jeff!!!  How much did u say?

[url]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E7YF6_ODMdM[/url]

Jeff,

If you don't mind me asking, what made you decide to sell?  I thought that card would be tied up in your collection for the long haul.

Mike
I don't know that I'm going to sell it.  But what's the 'long haul'?  Isn't every card potentially for sale at some point?  It just seems that the time is right to possibly sell it.
it's time!!!
Gotcha, best of luck with a potential sale.  It's a great card!

The cobby is sick.....and I wish I could afford it, but I always said that is a 
20K + inmho...... even before Doolan...good luck with the sale jeff, you r collection IS INSANE:eek:

There are less than 15 or so of these severe front miscuts I have seen over the years(Jordan, Knight,Doolan, Cobb, Dan's) ect ect...

kinda like the cobb back of miscut fronts:D....

sky really is the limit on these.....rarity is in the brown om/brown lenox  range:)
Hard to tell if  its miscut or 2 Ty Cobbs.
Wanna trade Jeff?  I'll cover the shipping on both ends, even though mine does have part of a third card on the top left...

I had one of those in the late 90's. (T206 green background miscut).  Mine wasn't miscut that bad though.  Basically had the name at the top and not the bottom.  Sold it to another Cobb collector here in Texas named Perry (can't remember his last name).    Wish I had it back after seeing the following that oddball stuff like that has.  I remember at the time thinking it was worth less than a regular cut Cobb due to the miscut LOL. I had purchased it from a guy named Phillip Tremont who was a big dealer down here in Texas

Oh well, live and learn

Mike

This one's a cinch inaugural member in the 'Scraps' HOF.

Wish I had $20K + in disposable income.
Wow, that's great!
New pic added!  Bid like you can afford the chicken AND the steak entrees at your wedding!
